Title: Lancashire Mining Museum
Description: On the edge of Chat Moss, in an area once full of collieries, lies the picturesque village of Astley Green. In the heart of the village stands Astley Green Colliery Museum which houses Lancashire's only surviving headgear and engine house, both of which now have…
Location: Astley Green Colliery Museum, Tyldesley, MANCHESTER, M29 7JB, 01942 895841

Title: Libraries in the Wigan Borough
Description: In all libraries you will find a huge selection of books on all kinds of subjects, as well as compact discs, videos, talking books, newspapers, magazines, DVDs and FREE use of the internet computers. Libraries are free to join Below is a list of all the…

Title: Museum of Wigan Life
Schedule: Open everyday apart from Sundays and Wednesdays
Description: We have lively displays on everything from sport and world war to music and festivals in Wigan, Leigh and across the borough. For full details please select the website below.

Title: Trencherfield Mill Engine
Description: Churning out a massive 2,500 horse power to feed the ever hungry machinery of Trencherfield Mill, it played an instrumental role in Wigan’s industrial development. For full information including opening times and cost please select the link below.
Location: Heritage Way, Wigan, WIGAN, LANCASHIRE, WN3 4EF

Title: The Turnpike
Description: The Turnpike offers a range of opportunities for children and young people to get involved in creative activities.
